captions.text: COMM: Meet Freddy, the Great Dane, who at

over seven foot is believed to be Britain's
biggest dog. Owner Claire Stoneman from Southend-on-sea,

acquired Freddy as a new born pup, along with
sister Fleur.
COMM: The runt of the litter, Freddy wasn't

always top dog, but soon went through a growth
spurt.
CLAIRE: He just started growing and growing
and growing, doing like an inch a month.

00:26
COMM: Each week the thirty eight-year-old

taxi driver spends a small fortune on Freddy's
food.

00:32
COMM: But on Freddy alone a probably spend

a good eighty, ninety pounds a week on the
food, he has 8 large cans of Butchers, 12lbs

of tripe a week, 12lbs of minced chicken a
week, four roast chickens as well so, he eats
a lot.
COMM: And living with eighteen month of Freddy

presents many challenges. From drink from
the kitchen tap, to going through 14 sofas,

Freddy and his sister Fleur have taken over
the house.
COMM: And when they're out of the house, even
going for a walk can be difficult.
COMM: But despite the madness each day brings,
Claire wouldn't change it for the world.
COMM: I love spending time with them, they're

my life, they're my babies, they're my number
one priority so everything I do revolves around

the dogs. I haven't got any children, they
are my fur-babies so I spoil them in the way
that somebody would spoil children.
COMM: Standing on his hind legs Claire measured

Freddy as seven foot four inches. At only
eighteen months old, he could become even

bigger, and surpass current Guinness world
record holder Zeus, who is also seven foot
four inches.
COMM: If he became the world's biggest dog

it would be great, I mean it would be totally
amazing, and obviously I'd expect to considering
how he started off his life being so small.
COMM: But while Claire is proud of Freddy's

size, she says her ultimate consideration
is the dog's welfare.
CLAIRE: All I want for my dogs is that they're

healthy and they're well so as long as he's
healthy that's the main thing for me.

comments.text: Why is a dog's life more important than a chicken's?﻿
comments.author: Radical Vegan Girl

comments.text:
They... arent... but chickens were created to be eaten, not to be 
companions. Why do cats eat birds? Does that mean the cat is judging the 
bird as less than itself? What about an otter smashing open a clam? Nah, 
it's just fulfilling the food chain. It's not like we're going into a guys 
house where he had pet chickens and killing them because they're 
chickens... it's just that those birds are bred specifically to eat.
comments.author: The Melodia

comments.text:
Hey, I'm sorry you're a fucking retard but this how nature works, animals 
eat each other. They do it in the wild, so its suddenly wrong if a Human in 
western civilisation does it? Or even a dog? Nobody's life is important 
than any other. But its just how life works. But if you were to rank one's 
life over another being. Humans have much more intelligence and can impact 
the world much more than a Chicken or a Dog can. Yes, they do have 
feelings, just like Pigs. Pigs have feelings and feel pain if we kill them 
unethically. But on the other hand, a pig would also eat a Human if given 
the chance. Why? Because its their nature, they're omnivores like us. Its 
how we've evolved. Please look at things with more of an anthropological 
view rather than you're small minded bigotry that all animals are equals. 
Its how the world works. Shut up.
comments.author: ENGMAC Gaming

comments.text:
Assuming there was an environment where dogs and chickens were in the same 
ecosystem, the dogs would hunt the chickens regardless.
comments.author: ENGMAC Gaming

comments.text:
+ENGMAC Gaming I'm the dumb one? First of all, I'm vegan, not vegetarian. 
Second, I never said that they aren't supposed to eat meat. I'm just saying 
that by having hundreds of chickens slaughtered for the sake of one animal 
you're obviously valuing that animal's life over the hundreds of chickens 
and cows just because you think think one's cuter or smarter. I've seen 
many vegan dogs who are healthier than meat eating dogs.
comments.author: Radical Vegan Girl

comments.text:
But they aren't essential to your survival in any way. People go their 
whole lives without eating any animal products and they turn out healthier 
than those who do. I've been vegan for a year now and I'm still alive and 
perfectly healthy. Check out the China Study, Starch Solution or Forks Over 
Knives. In the eyes of a cow, cows are probably the most important species. 
In the eyes of a dolphin, dolphins are probably more valuable than other 
species. Humans shouldn't be classified differently than animals because we 
are animals.
comments.author: Radical Vegan Girl

comments.text:
+Natalie Harvey To me other animals are just essential to my survival, so 
no their life isn't as valuable as mine. A human life is generally 
considered more valuable than an animal's because it's instinct to think 
that way.
comments.author: Carnageloser7

comments.text:
+Natalie Harvey They're animals and would eat the chickens regardless if 
domesticated or saw them in the wild. They're animals, its how the food 
chain works. Its what they've evolved to eat. Their ancestors ( wolves) 
literally only ate meat. Smh vegetarians are so dumb.
comments.author: ENGMAC Gaming

comments.text:
+Promoting Real Hip Hop Why do we eat chickens? We don't need to but we do 
anyways while we pamper domesticated animals. If you they're equal than 
treat them like they're equal.
